{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = Single Board Computer - Arietta G25 |caption2 = |pp = https://www.acmesystems.it/arietta |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = Arietta_G25 |wikipedia = |ddwrtsupport = |openwrtsupport = |tomatosupport = |gargoylesupport = |brand = Acme Systems |model = Arietta G25 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |series = |type = single-board computer |sernum = |fcc_id = |icid = |us_id = |boardid = |ecc_id = |cpu1chip1 = Atmel;AT91SAM9G25; |cpu1_cores = |cpu1_type = ARM926 |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 400 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = |flash1size = 0 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 128 |ram1chip = Samsung;K4T1G164QF-BIE6; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_none = true |bootwait = |stockbootloader = U-Boot;;; |stockos = Linux;;; |exp_if_types = Micro USB, Micro SD Card slot |exp_usb_num = 1 |exp_sdmmc_num = 1 |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = none (pads) |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = UART,, SPI,, I2C,, I2S |addchip = EMI Filter for T-Flash /MicroSD Interfaces;ON Semi;CM1624;;1;,,, 4-Pin MicroprocessorPower Supply Supervisor;On Semi;CAT811;;1;,,, 1.7MHz, 1A, Step-Down Converter;ON Semi;NCP1529;;3;,,, |802dot11_protocols = none |defaulip = |defaultlogin = root |defaultpass = acmesystems |is_manuf = Yes |tpfirmware = |availability = Long Term Availability to 2024 |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 01/2014 |estprice = 28 |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = Italy |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Can also be powered via USB OTG *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2014/01/19/9-99-euros-arietta-g25-board-features-atmel-sam9g25-arm9-processor/ ''9.99 Euros Arietta G25 Board Features Atmel SAM9G25 (ARM9)
Processor'' on '''CNX|Soft'''] *[http://linuxgizmos.com/tiny-arm9-module-runs-linux/ ''Tiny module runs Linux on ARM9-based Atmel SAM9G25 SoC'' on '''LinuxGizmos'''] *[https://hackaday.com/2014/11/01/arietta-g25-has-us-wondering-where-arm-boards-are-going/ ''Arietta G25 Has Us Wondering Where ARM Boards are Going'' on '''HACKADAY'''] ===Hardware specification=== *CPU: ''[[Atmel]]'' AT91SAM9G25 @400MHz ARM ARM926 *RAM: 128MB DDR2 RAM *Storage: MicroSD Card Slot [[Category:English Documentation]]
